title.@value: Low powered passenger vehicle as counterpart in land transport crash

definition.@value: (1) A land transport motor vehicle with three wheels (usually one in front and two behind), designed primarily for on-road use. Globally, most commonly used as taxis. Design, construction, type of motor and registration/licensing requirements vary widely. (2) A low-powered quadricycle or other low-powered four-wheeled passenger vehicle that is not a car.

label.@value: Low powered passenger vehicle as counterpart in land transport crash
Three wheeler as counterpart in land transport crash
